root: ^I'm at the clothing store where %FullName:NPC:1% works and I want to ask %Pron:1:2% out.
^Buy clothes first then ask %FullName:NPC:1% out at register.
^Ask %FullName:NPC:1% out first, then buy clothes after.
^Buy clothes and hand %FullName:NPC:1% my number on a piece of paper.

res1: ^When I'm trying to ask %FullName:NPC:1% out, there is a long line and I am holding it up and %Pron:1:1% turns me down.

^I got the feeling that %FullName:NPC:1% might've just turned me down because it was an awkward situation and I was holding up the line and so many people were around. Maybe I should've asked %Pron:1:2% out when there was less people around. Either way, I am bummed out because %Pron:1:1% turned me down.
res2: ^I ask %FullName:NPC:1% out and no one is around so I don't feel as pressured. And %Pron:1:1% says yes!

^Luckily, when I went to ask %FullName:NPC:1% out, no one was around, so it made asking %Pron:1:2% out easier. %Pron:1:1% said yes and I'm so happy. And then I came back through the line with my clothes and %Pron:1:1% actually gave me a discount on my clothes too!
res3: ^As I bought my clothes there was a huge line so I think this was the right choice. %FullName:NPC:1% said %Pron:1:1% would call me too.

^This was some quick thinking. I think I saved both of us some embarrassment because had I asked %FullName:NPC:1% out when all those people were around I think we both would've been blushing. Instead, I just slid %Pron:1:2% my number and %Pron:1:1% said %Pron:1:1% would call me. Alright! I think I got a date coming up soon!
